- PYUSD is a dollar-pegged stablecoin running on Ethereum and backed by cash equivalents and short-term treasuries.
- Customers can convert PYUSD to dollars and send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries via PayPal's Xoom payment platform with no fees.
- The move aims to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and provide a stable value for users.
- Stablecoins like PYUSD are digital assets pegged to something stable, such as the U.S. dollar, and are used to speed up trading transactions.
- PYUSD's market cap is currently $109 million, smaller than other stablecoins like Tether's USDT.

title: [FIP - 3XX] Authorize Fraxlend AMO for new pairs ( sUSDe/FRAX, USDe/FRAX )
summary: The Frax Core Team is proposing to authorize the Fraxlend AMO to deposit minted FRAX into two new pairs: sUSDe/FRAX and USDe/FRAX. Each pair represents a lending market for ERC-20 tokens, allowing users to participate in lending and borrowing activities. The goal is to create new financial opportunities for the FRAX community. The addition of these pairs will enhance the flexibility and opportunity of the FRAX stablecoin protocol without altering its base stability mechanism. The proposal is up for voting, with the option to authorize the Fraxlend AMO or do nothing.

title: Here are the next biggest crypto court cases with the SBF saga over

title: OpenAI API Key App Competition
summary: The article discusses an upcoming competition called the OpenAI API Key App Competition. The competition invites participants to develop something using the OpenAI API Key and post updates on Discord. The competition is set to begin on April 16, 2023. The author of the article plans to build a public good for EVM chains, utilizing the OpenAI API Key's capabilities for Ethereum development. The goal is to create a functional tool that allows users to attest that Ethereum assets across multiple EO or Contract Accounts are associated with a main account. The author also plans to integrate Ethereum Name Service to associate DNSSEC imported assets and show relations between sister or satellite sites within the domain space. The author seeks support from the ENS Community and provides links to their personal GitHub, the Ethereum Attestation Service library, Ethereum Name Service GitHub, and the ENS DAO Discussion Forum.

title: Google sues crypto app scammers, Crypto.com in Korea: Asia Express

- Google hopes to set a legal precedent and is bringing charges under the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) law.

title: Crypto VC investments increased 38% in first quarter breaking 2 year trend
summary:

- VCs invested in 250 crypto projects, a 49% increase from the previous quarter.
- Top VC firms included a16z, OKX Ventures, and Multicoin Capital and Protocol Labs.
- Ethereum hosted the most VC-funded projects, followed by Solana, Polygon, and Bitcoin.

title: Why I lost holdings stx?
summary: The author of the article shares their experience of losing their STX holdings on the Xverse app. They claim to have lost 100 STX, worth $350, due to the misuse of their 12-word passphrase by the Xverse app. The author tracked their STX and discovered that it was sent out of their wallet by third parties claiming to be the Xverse app. These parties swapped the author's STX coins, resulting in the loss of their funds. The author is now requesting assistance from the Stacks team to create a refund solution pool for users who have lost their assets instead of receiving staking rewards. They are seeking a refund or donation from the Stacks team or any users who can provide assistance. The author also shares their new wallet address for potential donations.

title: Solana struggles: Record 75% of users txs are failing... or are they?

- Increasing transaction priority fees won't solve the issue, and networking patches are needed.
- The recent price of Solana (SOL) has fallen by 3% in the last week.
- SOL is currently the fifth-largest cryptocurrency by market cap, with a total value of $81 billion.

title: Paraguay floats temp crypto mining ban as illegal ‘farms’ cripple grid
summary:
- Paraguay lawmakers propose a bill to temporarily ban crypto mining and related activities due to illegal crypto mines stealing power and disrupting the electricity supply.
- The ban would last for 180 days or until a full law is enacted and the power grid operator guarantees sufficient energy supply to crypto miners without affecting other users.
- The draft law aims to regulate crypto staking, creation of new crypto assets, and conservation and storage activities of crypto assets.
- The Alto Paraná region in Paraguay has seen 50 cases of interrupted power supply linked to illegal crypto mining.
- The ban is seen as a way to better supervise the industry, address consumer protection issues, and prevent money laundering and tax evasion.
- In 2022, Paraguay almost passed a tax and legal framework for the crypto sector but was vetoed due to concerns about high power consumption.

title: EU Watchdog Says Reordering Blockchain Transactions Might Be Market Abuse. Industry Says It's Not
summary:
- The European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) considers the practice of reordering blockchain transactions, known as maximum extractable value (MEV), as a potential form of market abuse.
- Some industry advocates argue that MEV plays a positive role in improving blockchain network efficiency and should not be considered market abuse.
- There is debate over whether MEV falls within the scope of the European Union's digital assets law, MiCA.
- ESMA's consultation on market abuse under MiCA includes references to MEV, suggesting that it may be subject to regulation.
- MEV reordering can lead to frontrunning and questions about market integrity, but it does not necessarily constitute market abuse in every instance.
- The industry seeks regulatory clarity on what scenarios involving MEV would be considered market abuse.

title: Ethereum registers 3x gains in Q1: What does Q2 hold?
summary:
- Ethereum saw significant gains in Q1, with its fees and revenue increasing nearly 1.8 times quarter-on-quarter and its earnings tripling.
- The total number of Ethereum holders reached 114.69 million, a growth of over 5%.
- Ethereum's circulating market cap increased by 48% and exceeded 350 billion.
- ETH's P/F ratio dropped by more than 34%, indicating a bullish signal.
- In Q2, Ethereum's exchange reserve was dropping, indicating low selling pressure, and its transaction volume and total number of transactions increased.
- The derivatives market also looked optimistic, with ETH's Funding Rate and Taker Buy Sell Ratio both indicating dominant buying sentiment.

title: Bitcoin spikes outside US hours and traders could ‘take advantage’ — Analyst
summary:
- Bitcoin has seen most of its daily gains come outside U.S. trading hours since the launch of spot Bitcoin ETFs.
- This trend allows traders to capitalize on frequent small profit margins.
- On April 4, Bitcoin rallied approximately 2.6% outside U.S. hours while prices only rose around 0.6% during U.S. hours.
- Bloomberg ETF analyst Eric Balchunas noted that the majority of Bitcoin's gains since spot Bitcoin ETFs were introduced happened outside regular U.S. market trading hours.
- Traders can buy Bitcoin ahead of U.S. trading hours and sell a few hours later to take advantage of this trend.
- U.S. investors tend to take advantage of the market spread between the spot market and the futures market.

title: Philippines SEC accuses eToro of offering unregistered securities
summary:
- Philippines SEC issues advisory against eToro, accusing the platform of offering unregistered securities in the country
- eToro is not registered as a corporation in the Philippines and lacks the necessary licenses to sell securities or operate as a broker-dealer
- The platform has over 33 million registered users worldwide and is valued at $3.5 billion
- The public is advised to exercise caution before investing in unregistered online investment platforms like eToro
- Individuals acting as salespeople or agents for eToro in the Philippines could face penalties of up to $88,300 or 21 years imprisonment
- The Philippines SEC previously issued a similar advisory against Binance in November 2023

title: PayPal Enables PYUSD to USD Conversions for International Money Transfers
summary:
- PayPal now allows US users to convert its stablecoin, PYUSD, to USD for international money transfers.
- The feature is available through PayPal's cross-border payments platform, Xoom, and can be used to send money to recipients in approximately 160 countries.
- No transaction fees will be charged for these transfers.
- PYUSD is not available to residents of Hawaii.
- PayPal's goal is to drive mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies and offer a secure and cost-effective way to send money internationally.
- The stablecoin market is becoming more competitive, with Ripple planning to launch its own USD-pegged stablecoin later this year.

title: Bitcoin at $67K can hit new ATH before halving ONLY IF...

title: Xverse stx bug
summary: The article discusses a bug in the Xverse STX contract that resulted in various issues for users. The bug caused a misleading address to be injected into the contract, leading to problems with staking and swapping tokens. Users experienced blocked transactions, frozen holdings, and incorrect rewards. Additionally, there were issues with delegating and deploying correct transactions. The bug also caused high calculations on the STX network and forced transfers between testnet and mainnet networks. The author mentions successful paired blocks and the creation of a micro block signed on the Bitcoin and STX blocks. The article concludes with a request for the return of lost tokens and mentions a new Earth-system.

title: Multi canister call
summary: The article discusses an issue with making a call from a client canister to a server canister in a decentralized application (dApp). The author has two canisters, one for the server and one for the client, which are deployed as separate projects. The author uses the agentCreate function to make a call to the server from the client. While the code works fine when run locally, it encounters errors when deployed on the blockchain. The errors include a "Bad Request" error and a "subnet_not_found" error. The article does not provide a solution to the issue but seeks assistance in resolving the problem.

title: Ripple’s New Stablecoin Looks to Boost XRP Adoption
summary:
- Ripple plans to launch a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar on the XRP Ledger and Ethereum.
- The stablecoin will be fully collateralized by US dollar deposits, short-term US government treasuries, and other cash equivalents.
- Ripple will have the reserve assets audited by a third-party accounting firm and publish monthly attestations.
- The move positions Ripple as a competitor to established stablecoin leaders like Tether and Circle.
- Ripple's stablecoin aims to drive more use cases, liquidity, and opportunities for developers and users.
- Ripple intends to integrate both XRP and the stablecoin into its payment solutions, targeting the US market initially.

title: Ethena Labs to Scale USDe Stablecoin with Bitcoin Backing
summary:

- The integration of Bitcoin aims to increase USDe's stability of $2 billion and leverage Bitcoin's liquidity.
- Ethena's hedges now account for about 20% of Ethereum's open interest.
- Bitcoin's growth in open interest provides enhanced scalability and liquidity for delta hedging.
- MakerDAO proposes a $600 million investment in USDe and its staked variant, sUSDe, via Morpho Labs.
- The investment aims to diversify MakerDAO's investments and reduce liquidity risks.

title: Dogecoiners clone hyped Bitcoin Ordinals ‘Runestone’ airdrop
summary:
- Dogecoin blockchain has completed its own "Runestone" airdrop, inspired by the Bitcoin Ordinals NFT-like giveaway.
- A total of 30,272 "Doge Runestone" Doginals were distributed to wallets holding at least one Doginal from a specified list.
- Doge Runestones are now trading at a floor price of 185 Dogecoin (DOGE), worth about $32, with a 24-hour volume of over $2,000.
- The airdrop imitated the Bitcoin Ordinals-based Runestone airdrop, which distributed over 112,000 Runestones to early adopters.

- Despite the airdrop, DOGE's price has not been positively impacted, currently trading at $0.1718, down 2% in the past day and 20% for the week.

title: Automata advances TEE research with Brevis to enhance ZK Coprocessing
summary: Automata is partnering with Brevis to integrate Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) as an additional layer of security and verification in Brevis coChain. Brevis is a zero-knowledge (ZK) coprocessor platform that aims to enhance the capabilities of blockchains in handling data-intensive and heavy computation in a trust-free manner. The partnership will enable node operators in the coChain to run Automata's TEE prover, which will enhance security and potentially increase stake delegation. Brevis also plans to implement a softer slashing condition for node operators who run the coprocessing logic in TEE. The collaboration between Automata and Brevis combines the strengths of ZK proofs and TEE attestations, offering new possibilities for secure and scalable decentralized computing.

title: Crypto Derivatives Lost Overall Market Share in March Despite Hitting Record High Trading Volume of $6.18T

- However, the market share of crypto derivatives declined for the sixth consecutive month, reaching 67.8%.
- Spot trading volume on centralized exchanges surged 108% to $2.94 trillion, the highest since May 2021.
- Combined spot and derivatives trading volume hit a record $9.12 trillion, up 92.9%.
- The decline in derivatives' market share may be positive for crypto bulls anticipating a continued price rally.
- Bitcoin rose 16.6% in March, reaching new record highs above $73,000.

title: TRALA LAB Commits to zkSync to Revolutionize and Advance Global Gaming Industry
summary:
- TRALA LAB, a subsidiary of Joycity, commits to building on zkSync, a zero-knowledge (ZK) technology, to revolutionize the global gaming industry.
- TRALA LAB collaborates with Matter Labs to leverage technical expertise and develop AAA games on zkSync.
- The collaboration aims to drive innovation and address challenges in the gaming market.
- TRALA LAB plans to onboard popular game IPs, such as Gunship Battle and Freestyle, onto the zkSync ecosystem.
- The strategic collaboration will also involve launching TRALA's gaming platform using the ZK Stack.
- TRALA LAB aims to set new standards for quality game content and utilize its global marketing channels to introduce a new wave to the world stage.

title: Ethena Onboards Bitcoin as Backing Asset to Make USDe 'Safer'
summary:

title: PayPal Enables No-Fee Cross-Border Transfer Using Native Stablecoin PYUSD

title: Where is assetstorage.wasm.gz in DFX?
summary: The author of the article is questioning the source of two files, assetstorage.wasm.gz and frontend.wasm.gz, in the DFX project. They are unable to find any downloading code in the DFX sources and are seeking information on the URL from which to download these files.

title: Standardize ragequit proposals and make it a feature and not a bug
summary: The article proposes standardizing ragequit proposals in order to make governance more effective and establish clear expectations. The proposal suggests a standardized formula for ragequits, which includes forfeiting 100% of rewards, a 5% flat fee, and an additional 0.5% per month left. The author suggests that this standardized ragequit option should be available from the start for all new gauges/locks, without requiring governance approval. However, for old pairs, governance approval would be necessary to enable the ragequit function. The article also suggests that the rewards and LP from the ragequit should be added to the FLE (Flexible Liquidity Equivalent) to benefit the protocol and increase revenue and liquidity. This approach aims to make ragequits a feature rather than a bug, benefiting both users and the protocol.

title: Coinbase to Add Worldcoin and Perpetual Futures Products for the Ordinals Next Week

- Perpetual futures contracts are derivative financial instruments traded on crypto exchanges without an expiration date.
- Perpetual futures mimic the price of the underlying asset and settle periodically to the spot price.
- Traders use perpetual futures for speculation, hedging, and arbitrage, but it carries risks such as volatility and potential liquidation.

title: Australian Monochrome spot Bitcoin ETF expected to launch within 2 months, says CEO
summary:
- Monochrome, an Australian asset manager, plans to launch a spot Bitcoin ETF on Cboe Australia.
- This ETF will be the first in Australia to directly hold Bitcoin.
- Monochrome has received approval from the Australian Securities Exchange and expects Cboe Australia to clear its application by June.
- The selection of Cboe Australia aligns with Monochrome's strategic vision and market reach.
- The Monochrome spot Bitcoin ETF provides a transparent pathway to exposure, similar to how spot Bitcoin ETFs are structured in the United States.
- The success of spot BTC ETFs in the US has prompted other countries to consider introducing similar products.

title: South Korea implements tougher rules for crypto exchange listings
summary:
- South Korean financial authorities are set to release new guidelines for token listings on centralized crypto exchanges by the end of April or early May.
- Digital assets with hacking incidents will be prohibited from being listed on domestic exchanges unless the root cause is determined.
- Foreign digital assets can only be listed on domestic exchanges if a white paper or technical manual is published for the South Korean market.
- Tokens already listed on a licensed exchange for over two years may be exempt from the new criteria.
- Exchanges may be required to remove cryptocurrencies from their listings if issuers fail to disclose essential information.
- The South Korean government is seeking feedback from local exchanges and has implemented stricter regulations due to recent industry crises and increased suspicious transactions.

title: Owning a House in the US Becomes 45% More Expensive in 2024

- Analysts predict that house prices will continue to rise, and there is no sign of a price correction in the US housing market.

title: Gold outperforms S&P 500 YTD as economic uncertainty looms

- Companies may face challenges in servicing their debt due to the federal funds rate and rate cut expectations being pushed back.
- Bitcoin, often compared to "digital gold," has surged over 50% year-to-date, reinforcing its narrative as a hedge against economic uncertainty.

title: Bitcoin miner Marathon rolls out ‘phased plan’ to reduce noise in Texas as demand for BTC soars

- Marathon will also extend a sound barrier and plant trees around the perimeter of the site.
- Residents have complained about the noise for the past two years, causing health problems and driving away wild animals.
- The Bitcoin mining industry is facing criticism for noise pollution, excessive water usage, and tax breaks.
- Demand for Bitcoin is high, leading major banks to contact mining companies to buy Bitcoin directly.

- The three phases of the Bitcoin halving are the final pre-halving retrace, re-accumulation, and parabolic uptrend.
- The retrace period offers a bargain-buying opportunity and sets up the next phase in the cycle.

title: Roger Ver was right about Bitcoin
summary:
- The article discusses Roger Ver's book, "Hijacking Bitcoin," which presents a historical account of Bitcoin's development and the blocksize wars.
- Ver argues that Bitcoin was hijacked and has deviated from its original design as a scalable electronic cash system.
- The blocksize wars were a period of intense debate over the maximum amount of transaction data a block could hold.
- Ver advocated for on-chain scaling and larger block sizes, while others, mainly core developers, supported off-chain solutions like Lightning Network and SegWit.
- The debate led to a hard fork in August 2017, resulting in the creation of Bitcoin Cash and the implementation of SegWit on the Bitcoin chain.
- The article emphasizes the importance of understanding Bitcoin's history and its impact on the crypto industry.

title: Starknet explains reasons for four-hour block outage
summary:
- Ethereum layer-2 protocol Starknet experienced a four-hour block outage due to a rounding error bug.
- The block reorganization caused a transaction backlog and rejection of new transactions.
- Starknet's status page did not reflect the outage, and additional information from the company is still pending.
- Solana, another blockchain network, has also faced multiple outages, including a recent one due to a bug in its Just-in-Time compilation cache.
- Solana has seen half a dozen significant outages and 15 partial or major outage days since January 2022.
- Analysts attribute Solana's recent failed transactions to bot activity during the memecoin mania.

title: 🎬 What’s New In March: The Latest Nexo Card Upgrades
summary: Nexo Card, a bridge between crypto and everyday life, has introduced new upgrades in March. The card offers both Credit and Debit modes for spending flexibility. In Credit Mode, users can borrow against their digital assets and earn up to 2% crypto cashback. Debit Mode allows users to spend their crypto directly, including stablecoins, without the need to move funds to separate wallets. The first upgrade allows users to manage the assets used for Debit Mode purchases and set the order of spending. Users can disable assets they don't want to spend and change the spending priority with a simple drag and drop feature. The second upgrade enhances transaction history by categorizing transactions and providing information about the merchant. Nexo is also working on developing a complete analytics hub for a more detailed breakdown of spending habits.

summary: Scammers are taking advantage of the cryptocurrency hype and luring people into bogus investment opportunities, resulting in a surge of reports to the FTC's Consumer Sentinel. title: History of Crypto: Crypto winter and Ethereum landmarks
summary:
- The cryptocurrency market has experienced cycles of rapid price increases (bull runs) followed by extended downturns (crypto winters).
- Crypto winter refers to a phase of declining prices and investor enthusiasm in the cryptocurrency market.
- The crypto winter of 2018 saw Bitcoin and Ether lose over 80% of their value from their all-time highs.
- Factors contributing to the 2018 crypto winter included high failure rates of initial coin offerings, regulatory concerns, and investor withdrawal.
- Ethereum faced delays in its transition to a proof-of-stake (PoS) system and explored sharding for scalability.
- In 2019, Ethereum gained mainstream recognition and saw significant growth in decentralized finance (DeFi) and decentralized exchanges.

title: Securing your crypto funds: Exchanges add support for hardware 2FA
summary:
- Phishing scams are on the rise, with 29 million reported in the UK since 2024 and over 324,000 crypto users falling victim in 2023.
- Some cryptocurrency exchanges, like Coinbase and Binance, are encouraging users to use hardware devices like YubiKey for added security.
- YubiKey devices serve as a form of two-factor authentication (2FA) and require physical access to the device, making them more secure than SMS or email codes.
- Coinbase also supports a new form of MFA called "passkeys," which are a cryptographic technique linked to a user's device.
- While hardware devices like YubiKey and passkeys can protect against phishing attacks, they cannot protect against cryptocurrency exchange hacks.
- Users may also consider using hardware wallets for added security, but losing the private keys could result in unrecoverable funds.

title: South Korea to Tighten Token Exchange Regulations, Including Blocking Hacked Tokens
summary:
- South Korea is set to introduce stricter regulations for token listing on exchanges, including blocking hacked tokens.
- The Financial Supervisory Service has been working on listing guidelines since last year, gathering input from exchanges.
- Tokens that have been hacked and have not resolved security issues may be blocked from listing.
- Virtual assets with a history of hacking or security incidents will not be eligible for listing unless the cause has been explained and damages recovered.
- The guidelines also outline standards for delisting, such as failure to comply with disclosure obligations.
- South Korea's rival political parties are presenting policy proposals to institutionalize crypto-assets.

title: Cryptocurrencies slip while stocks bounce on red-hot jobs data
summary:
- Cryptocurrencies slipped while stocks bounced in pre-market trading after US jobs data exceeded expectations.
- The US economy added 303,000 jobs in March, surpassing the expected figure of 212,000.
- Bitcoin and ether dipped 1% and 3% respectively on the news.
- Stocks were inching higher during pre-market trading, with Dow and Nasdaq futures gaining 0.2% and 0.4%.
- Strong economic data could lead central bankers to halt plans on rate cuts.
- Traders are cautious, recognizing that the jobs report is just one data point among many.

title: Experts worry Ethena’s Bitcoin-backing strategy for USDe could bring ‘contagion risks’
summary:
- Ethena Labs plans to incorporate Bitcoin as a backing asset for its USDe synthetic dollar.
- CryptoQuant CEO Ki Young Ju raises concerns about potential contagion risks for Bitcoin holders, drawing parallels with Terra Luna's failed algorithmic UST stablecoin.
- Fantom creator Andre Cronje also expresses apprehensions about USDe's safety and resilience in adverse market conditions.
- Defenders of Ethena argue that there is no risk of liquidation and highlight the platform's straightforward cash-and-carry trade strategy.
- Ethena uses minted assets to acquire BTC, which is then used as collateral to offset BTC declines in perpetual futures trading.
- Ryan Watkins, co-founder of Syncracy Capital, dismisses concerns as FUD and suggests looking elsewhere for potential risks.

title: Bhutan’s DHI to offset halving effects with Bitcoin mining upgrade
summary:
- Bhutan's sovereign investment arm, DHI, and Bitdeer Technologies will increase their Bitcoin mining capacity to offset the impact of the halving.
- The planned upgrades will raise Bhutan's mining capacity by 500 megawatts, bringing the total to 600 megawatts by the first half of 2025.
- The funds for the upgrade will come from a $500 million fund announced by DHI and Bitdeer last year.
- Bhutan has been using hydropower to mine BTC since 2019.
- Some believe that the halving of BTC rewards will be compensated by an increase in network fees and the use of Bitcoin-based nonfungible tokens (NFTs).
- Grayscale estimated that Bitcoin Ordinals generated over $200 million in transaction fees for miners as of February 2024.

title: Former nChain CEO funded UK Tories without permission, report
summary:
- Former nChain CEO, Christen Ager-Hanssen, allegedly directed the crypto firm to donate £70,000 to the UK Tory party without shareholder approval.
- The donation was made in July 2023 while Ager-Hanssen was in talks with senior party officials to create an app called 'True Blue.'
- The True Blue app was projected to generate £160 million ($201 million) annually for the party through various revenue streams.
- nChain learned of the donation after firing Ager-Hanssen in September 2023, stating there was no board or shareholder approval.
- This action may have violated section 366 of the Companies Act, which prohibits political donations without member approval.
- Ager-Hanssen has also been involved in leaking documents and employing espionage tactics in the past.

- Uniswap is the largest DEX in terms of trading volume, with $21.6 billion in volume over the past week alone.
- Uniswap's performance indicates steady growth and increasing trader confidence in DeFi solutions, challenging centralized exchanges like Binance and Coinbase.
- A research study found that Uniswap has deeper liquidity in important crypto trading pairs compared to Binance and Coinbase.

title: Analyst Calls BRICS a ‘Superpower’

title: Avalanche Community Grants Quadratic Funding: [Round #1] Stable Jack
summary: Stable Jack, an Avalanche native LSTfi protocol, is developing a yield-bearing stablecoin called aUSD and a volatile AVAX token called xAVAX. The protocol aims to offer capital efficiency, no liquidation risk, and no exposure to centralized party risks for aUSD, while providing DeFi composability, no funding fees, and low liquidation risk for xAVAX. The project benefits the Avalanche ecosystem by creating demand for AVAX, unlocking AVAX LST liquidity, introducing new use cases for AVAX, and increasing security through the utilization of LST protocols. Stable Jack also plans to attract liquidity from other chains to Avalanche by providing the first yield-bearing and decentralized stablecoin in the ecosystem. The project is 5 months old and has received $103k in prior funding from angel investors. Stable Jack has already launched its testnet and is working on frontend bug fixes and design updates. The project is currently undergoing an audit by Credshields.

title: Shinobi: How Covenants Help Scale Bitcoin
summary:
- The article discusses how covenants can help scale Bitcoin.
- Covenants are smart contracts that allow for more complex transactions on the Bitcoin network.
- They can enable features like time-locked transactions and multi-signature wallets.
- Covenants can improve scalability by reducing the amount of data needed to be stored on the blockchain.
- They can also enhance privacy and security by allowing for more advanced transaction types.
- Overall, covenants have the potential to make Bitcoin more flexible and efficient.

title: Binance exec Tigran Gambaryan transferred to an underground jail cell as Nigerian crisis escalates
summary:
- Binance executive Tigran Gambaryan has been transferred to an underground jail cell in Nigeria.
- The transfer was prompted by the escape of another Binance executive, Nadeem Anjarwalla.
- Gambaryan was previously under house arrest and is now being held in a jail managed by Nigeria's anti-corruption agency.
- He has been charged with money laundering and tax violations alongside Binance.
- The transfer is seen as a targeted escalation by the Nigerian government against Binance.
- Gambaryan may be transferred to a federal detention center if the case goes to trial.

- Sony Group is also collaborating with Startale Labs to establish its own public blockchain network, showing its commitment to embracing Web3 technologies.

title: BREAKING: Lawmakers stall digital euro bill, leaving future of €1.2bn project uncertain
summary:
- Lawmakers in the European Parliament have stalled on creating a legal framework for the digital euro, leaving the future of the €1.2bn project uncertain.
- The new European Parliament, after elections in June, will decide whether to start from scratch, pick up the pieces, or scrap the project completely.
- Key issues like holding limits and transaction history remain unresolved, leading to a lack of robust compromises.
- Privacy and financial stability concerns have sparked backlash and conspiracy theories around the digital euro.
- The European Central Bank has put the project on hold until the legislation is finalized.
- Experts anticipate that the right-consolidated European Parliament post-elections will have an easier time agreeing on legislation for the digital euro.

title: Are Layer 3s the Future?
summary:
- Layer 3s, also known as appchains, are being considered as the next step in scaling after Ethereum's Dencun upgrade.
- Layer 3s offer tailored environments for specific communities and use cases, such as enterprise blockchain applications or gaming.
- They provide extensive customizability, reduced settlement costs, arenas for experimentation, privacy enhancements, and new economic models.
- Examples of Layer 3s include Yuga's Apechain, Azuki's Animechain, DegenChain, Frame Chain, and Xai Network.
- Leading frameworks for building Layer 3s are Arbitrum Orbits, OP Stack, and Starknet.
- While there are critiques and debates about the implications of Layer 3s, they offer efficiency, customizability, and user engagement in the short term.

title: Solana Gets Slammed
summary:
- Failed transactions are surging on Solana, making the chain practically unusable for regular users.

- Bots are more effective at producing spam, leaving real human users unable to transact.
- Some suggest implementing an economic solution similar to Ethereum's EIP-1559 upgrade to address the issue.

title: Montenegro’s Supreme Court sends Do Kwon’s extradition case back to lower court
summary:
- Montenegro's Supreme Court has overturned a lower court decision regarding the extradition of Do Kwon, co-founder of Terraform Labs.
- The Supreme Court approved a request for a protection of legality against the lower court's decision to extradite Kwon to South Korea.
- The decision on Kwon's extradition will now be returned to the High Court in Podgorica, which will determine whether he will be sent to the US or South Korea.
- Kwon faces criminal charges in both countries and has been in Montenegro since his arrest in March 2023.
- Kwon is currently free to travel within Montenegro until the courts make a decision on his extradition case.
- Terraform Labs' former CFO, Han Chang-joon, has already been extradited to South Korea, and several individuals connected to Terraform Labs have been indicted by South Korean authorities.

title: Proposal: Improve advanced delegation voting
summary: The article discusses a proposal to improve advanced delegation voting in the governance smart contract of the Optimism token house. The proposal aims to allow voters who have received their voting power from advanced delegation to vote by signing only one transaction instead of two. This update is motivated by feedback from a small group of voters who found the current process inconvenient. The upgrade will not result in any state changes to the governance contracts and is expected to have minimal impact as only a small number of users have advanced voting power. The proposed change is currently being audited by Open Zeppelin for security considerations. If approved, the Optimism Foundation will set the new implementation of the governor proxy, enabling delegates with advanced voting power to have a better user experience by signing only one transaction when voting.

title: Balancer Grants Q1 2024 / Wave 11 Update
summary: The Balancer Grants program has completed its Wave 11 update, which ran from January to March 2023. During this wave, the program focused on mentorship and support for existing grantees, funding projects dedicated to increasing adoption of Balancer V3, and setting aside funding for research and moonshot projects. The program approved two grants for projects building novel use cases and core functionality on Balancer V3. However, no grants were awarded for research and moonshot projects as no suitable proposals were received. The program also highlighted the achievements of previous grantees, including Dynamo, Protofire, and Notional Finance. The article concludes by announcing the funding proposal for Q2 2024, which includes top-ups for the grants treasury. The Balancer Grants program encourages individuals and groups to apply for grants to support the development of the Balancer Protocol and ecosystem.

title: Trader piles $118m into bet Bitcoin will outperform Ether
summary:

- The trader executed the trade via the DeFi protocol Aave, depositing wBTC and borrowing Ether.
- The strategy reflects a bearish outlook on Ethereum, as the trader profits from declines in Ether's value against Bitcoin.
- The trader's wallet, labeled as belonging to Multicoin Capital, now holds 2,648 wBTC and is borrowing 35,894 Ether.
- Since adding to the position on April 3, Ether has fallen 3% relative to Bitcoin, indicating the bet is paying off so far.
- The position's health factor, currently at 1.19, is considered low-risk, but liquidation could occur if the value of Ether significantly increases relative to Bitcoin.

title: Solana Network Addresses Complaints Amid Transaction Issues

title: Grayscale drops Cardano and Cosmos from its crypto funds in quarterly rebalancing

title: Proposal for Funding Stabila: Driving Stablecoin Adoption on Celo
summary: The Stabila Foundation has proposed a funding plan to drive the adoption of stablecoins on the Celo blockchain. The foundation aims to increase awareness, education, and ecosystem growth, particularly in emerging markets like Africa, Latin America, and Southeast Asia. Stablecoins play a crucial role in providing stability to crypto markets, and the Celo blockchain's technical features make it an attractive platform for launching stablecoins. Stabila seeks funding of 5 million CELO over 12 months to execute its strategic roadmap, which includes initiatives to drive adoption, educational outreach, infrastructure integration, and liquidity support for new currency stables. The proposal includes two programs: the Stabila Reward Program and the Stabila Partner Program. The expected outcomes of the funding plan include Celo becoming a leading chain for stablecoin activity, increased educational outreach, enhanced infrastructure and accessibility, and a diverse and resilient stablecoin ecosystem.

title: BlackRock Adds Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, UBS as APs for Bitcoin ETF
summary:
- BlackRock has added Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, UBS, Citadel Securities, and ABN AMRO as authorized participants for the iShares Bitcoin Trust.
- This brings the total number of APs to nine, including Jane Street Capital, JPMorgan, Macquarie, and Virtu Americas.
- APs help create liquidity by changing the supply of shares when there's a shortage or surplus.
- The iShares Bitcoin Trust has nearly $18 billion in assets under management.
- Goldman Sachs' participation is notable as its wealth management chief investment officer recently stated that crypto has "no value."
- The participation of traditional finance giants like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan in the Bitcoin ETF space is reminiscent of their initial skepticism towards cryptocurrencies.

- In March alone, over $1.1 billion was allocated across 180 crypto VC investments.

title: How to Forge a Successful Metaverse Gaming Career
summary: The article discusses the opportunities and skills required for a successful career in metaverse gaming. The metaverse gaming industry has experienced significant growth, with a projected market value of $119.2 billion by 2028. The introduction of live dealers in online casino games within the metaverse has enhanced the gaming experience and attracted more players. Key skills for success in metaverse gaming include game programming, creating engaging content, and virtual world design. The article also highlights various job opportunities in the metaverse gaming industry, such as game developers, community coordinators, and blockchain specialists. Building a strong portfolio, networking, and staying updated with industry trends are essential for career advancement. Education in computer science or marketing, with a focus on virtual reality technology, is recommended for aspiring metaverse gaming professionals. The future of metaverse gaming careers looks promising, with the industry expected to grow significantly and create job opportunities in diverse fields like AI, AR/VR, blockchain, and digital currencies.

- DWS and Galaxy Digital teamed up a year ago to develop ETPs for listing in Europe.
- The move comes as spot crypto ETPs gain more attention following the approval of ETFs in the US.

title: BlackRock updates Bitcoin ETF, adds 5 Wall Street firms

- BlackRock has updated its Bitcoin ETF prospectus, adding five Wall Street firms as new authorized participants.
- The new members include ABN AMRO Clearing, Citadel Securities, Citigroup Global Markets, Goldman Sachs, and UBS Securities.
- Authorized participants play a crucial role in the BTC ETF operational mechanism, creating and redeeming shares of the ETF.
- The SEC's position on a cash creation and redemption mechanism for Bitcoin ETFs aims to mitigate market manipulation risks.
- Bitcoin ETFs saw a spike in trading volume in March, reaching $111 billion, but some analysis suggests demand is cooling down.

title: Front Row - decentralised ticketing platform offering fully on-chain, dynamic and tradable digital tickets
summary: Front Row is a decentralised ticket marketplace built on the Internet Computer blockchain. It aims to revolutionize the customer experience in the entertainment industry by offering fully on-chain, dynamic, and tradable digital tickets. The platform is designed as an alternative to Ticketmaster, which has faced criticism for overpricing and limited accessibility. Front Row plans to release 100% of available tickets in the first release, making them more affordable and accessible. It will also use blockchain technology to limit the number of tickets individuals can purchase, preventing bots from buying and reselling tickets at higher prices. Additionally, Front Row will provide a trustworthy and tamper-proof marketplace for the second-hand sale of tickets through peer-to-peer transactions. The platform aims to address issues of ticket scarcity, overpricing, and counterfeiting in the ticketing industry. It plans to launch in December 2023 and expand to other blockchains in the future.

title: Avalanche Community Grants Quadratic Funding: [Round #1] DefiLlama
summary: The article discusses the Avalanche Community Grants program and its first round recipient, DefiLlama. DefiLlama is a project that provides analytics and a discovery service for projects within the Avalanche ecosystem. It offers information on metrics such as total value locked (TVL), decentralized exchange (DEX) volume, and revenue. The project has been supporting Avalanche since 2021 and aims to help users navigate the ecosystem safely while providing a neutral viewpoint for comparing projects. DefiLlama is over three years old and has received prior funding from grants by Optimism, DeFi projects, self-funding, llamaswap revenue, and Gitcoin donations. The article includes a link to DefiLlama's public group chat on Discord and mentions the Telegram handle of one of the main team members. The payout wallet address for the grant payment on Avalanche C-Chain is also provided.

title: IvorieChat, a chat-to-earn platform [Quadratic Funding Round #1]
summary: IvorieChat is a chat-to-earn platform that aims to revolutionize online interactions by turning conversations into lucrative opportunities. The platform utilizes blockchain technology to provide a secure and transparent environment for communication and monetization. Users can earn cryptocurrency rewards for their active participation and valuable communications with others. IvorieChat operates on a fair revenue-sharing model, allowing users to offer their time and expertise for paid chat services. The platform charges a commission fee of 5%-10% on each paid chat session. To incentivize high-quality chat services, IvorieChat offers additional features such as profile customization and a user rating and review system. The project aligns with the Avalanche Foundation's mission of promoting financial inclusion and decentralization. It also diversifies the use cases of blockchain technology and generates significant transaction volume, contributing to network security. IvorieChat provides income generation opportunities, flexibility, accessibility, financial inclusion, skill development, community support, and social engagement. The project is less than one year old and is currently in the development phase.

title: Avalanche Community Grants Quadratic Funding: [Round #1] GECKO INU
summary: The article discusses a proposal for the Avalanche Community Grants Quadratic Funding, specifically for the project called GECKO INU. GECKO INU is described as a community-driven project on the Avalanche network, with a focus on genuine utilities rather than just being a meme coin. The project has built an ecosystem around Gecko Inu on Avalanche, including features such as a crosschain aggregator for multichain swaps, a launchpad for Avalanche projects, NFT collections, and a Telegram bot for managing wallets on Avax. The project aims to benefit the Avalanche ecosystem and mentions existing or upcoming partnerships with various entities such as yieldyak, Bitget Wallet, OKX Wallet, and more. The project has been active since December 20, 2023, and has received prior funding of $200,000. The article provides links to the project's Telegram group chat and social media profiles of team members.

title: Staava Protocol Quadratic Funding Round Application
summary: Staava Protocol is a blockchain project built on Avalanche C-Chain and a compatible Subnet (EVM) blockchain. It aims to introduce the concept of scarcity within the capabilities of EVMs. The protocol offers a range of web 3.0 solutions and tools. The projected use-cases and products include a staking dApp for earning rewards with custom tokens, a scarcity dApp that rewards users for creating scarcity with AVAX and other VsTs on SE-CHAIN, a credit dApp for low-interest loans in USDT using $STAAV, $AVAX, and VsTs, a token creation dApp with support from the Ecosystem Development Fund, an exercise to earn dApp, a program for blockchain education and charity support in Africa, a DEX, and NFTs for RWA developments. Staava Protocol is seeking funding and development support from the Avalanche Community Grants program to achieve its goals, including core development, Pan-African outreach, and research and implementation of real-world assets (RWA). The protocol aims to become a prominent subnet of the Avalanche ecosystem.

title: Even crypto friendly UK banks freeze accounts in fear of crypto transactions

- Revolut, known as a crypto-friendly bank, froze an account and blocked a wallet address without clear explanation.
- Similar incidents have occurred in the US, with traditional banks closing accounts of long-time customers involved in crypto.
- Lack of transparency and abrupt account closures raise concerns about the motivations behind these actions.
- The UK's "positive friction" approach to regulation introduces barriers and checks to slow down crypto investments.
- The author questions the fear of crypto by banks and highlights the need for common sense regulation.

title: Do Kwon extradition reversed yet again in Supreme Court ruling

- The first instance court should determine the legal conditions for extradition before the Minister of Justice decides on permission and order of priority.
- Do Kwon's case will continue in the High Court in Podgorica.
- The legal battle to extradite Do Kwon continues.

title: Culture Blocks - Co-created memes that can be linked together to form complex cultures and social graphs
summary: The article discusses the concept of "Culture Blocks," an app that aims to create co-created memes that can be linked together to form complex cultures and social graphs. The author explains that dopamine rewards for pro-social behavior are a biological feature that is over 500 million years old. The app is currently up for a grant and the author encourages feedback and criticism. The article explores the idea of memes as units of cultural information that can replicate, evolve, and undergo natural selection. The author proposes that an app could allow memes to be created, mutated, and replicated by groups, forming links to incubate and grow into complex cultures. The author suggests anonymizing users to remove the influence of previous cultural links and allow for authentic expression. The article also discusses the potential for social connections and the creation of new cultural narratives through the minting of memes. The author believes that this app could lead to the rapid discovery and development of new foundational layers of society.

title: Goldman, Citi, and Citadel Securities among new partners in BlackRock ETF’s ‘mega absurd success’

- These firms join other authorized participants like JPMorgan Securities, Macquarie, ABN Amro, Jane Street Capital, and Virtu Americas.
- Authorized participants have the sole rights to create or reduce the number of ETF shares on the market, contributing to ETF liquidity.
- BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF, named IBIT, has reached $17 billion in total assets under management, making it one of the most successful ETFs to ever launch.
- The addition of more authorized participants indicates growing acceptance and legitimacy of crypto-backed ETFs among mainstream financial institutions.

title: Is The Atlas Credit Card Legit?
summary:
- The Atlas Credit Card is a legitimate credit-building tool designed to help individuals establish or improve their credit scores.
- It operates like a traditional credit card, allowing users to make purchases and build a positive credit history over time.
- The card is issued by Patriot Bank, a reputable financial institution, ensuring safety and security for users' personal and financial information.
- Atlas reports to major credit bureaus, reflecting positive payment history in users' credit reports.
- The card has high approval rates and offers a spending limit that can increase over time with responsible credit management.
- Overall, the Atlas Credit Card is a valuable opportunity for individuals looking to improve their financial health and credit scores.

title: BRICS: 7 Countries Testing Tokenization as Competition Increases
summary:
- 7 countries, including France, Japan, Korea, Mexico, Switzerland, England, and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, are testing tokenization factors as competition against the BRICS alliance increases.
- The Bank of International Settlements (BIS) is partnering with these countries for the integration of tokenized financial systems through Project Agorá.
- The BRICS alliance has been embracing digital asset technology and announced a blockchain-based payment system, but the recent tokenization project from the West poses new competition.
- The BIS project aims to explore the tokenization of cross-border payments, similar to the BRICS payment system, to transform the current monetary system.
- Tokenization has attracted interest from businesses and central banks, with the potential to tokenize all asset classes.
- The BRICS alliance seeks to implement tokenization to reduce reliance on the US dollar, while it is unclear if the BIS project would have similar inclusive parameters for participating countries.

title: Vultur Android Malware
summary: Vultur is an Android banking malware that has recently been updated with new features. The malware allows threat actors to remotely interact with a victim's device and includes encrypted C2 communication. Vultur uses the Brunhilda dropper framework and has been active since March 2021. It is the first Android banking malware to have a screen recording feature, facilitating keylogging and enabling threat actors to target banking apps. The updated version of Vultur is spread through a hybrid attack using SMS and phone calls. Victims receive a financial-themed SMS claiming an unauthorized transaction and are directed to call a phone number. The threat actor then sends a second SMS with a link to the dropper, disguised as the McAfee Security app. The dropper deploys Vultur using three payloads and registers with the Brunhilda C2. The new version of Vultur includes additional capabilities such as file manipulation, device control, app prevention, custom notifications, and lock screen bypass. It also improves detection evasion and anti-analysis features, encrypts C2 communication, and adds new C2 methods and Firebase Cloud Messaging commands.

- Critics argue that changing the tokenomics won't improve Ethereum's economic model and that the Ethereum Foundation has an outsized power in governance.
- The Ethereum Foundation researchers clarified that the proposal was meant for community consideration and requires broad buy-in.

title: Season 5: Intents Budget Proposal #2
summary: The Grants Council is proposing to use 1.040.000 OP from the Gov Fund to reallocate it to various mission requests. The total OP approved via these mission requests is 6799000, with a remaining unallocated amount of 1199000 to be returned to the Gov Fund. Additionally, the Grants Council will allocate 1M OP already approved by Token House to mission requests for growth and experiments grants program, smart contract auditing services, and OP stack research and implementation. If the Grants Council does not receive additional funding, they will have to decrease the number of finalists in Cycle 22. title: Ic-payroll .Hrms And Payroll on the IC
summary: Ic-Payroll is a HR management and payroll solution built on the Internet Computer (IC) blockchain. The platform aims to streamline HR operations, enhance efficiency, and reduce costs for individuals and SMEs. It leverages IC technologies to offer advantages such as decentralized authentication through Internet Identity, efficient cross-border payments using ckBTC, and cost-effective hosting compared to traditional cloud providers. The frontend of the platform is built using Vue.js and Tailwind CSS, while the backend utilizes Motoko for smart contracts and interaction with the blockchain. The project also utilizes features of the Internet Computer such as orthogonal persistence and HTTPS outcalls. While not yet live, the project has made progress in development and plans to integrate with ERC-20 tokens, support multiple blockchains, and offer an off-ramp for users to convert earnings into fiat currency or other cryptocurrencies.

title: Terra Founder Do Kwon Found Liable for Fraud in SEC Lawsuit
summary:

- The collapse of TerraUSD and its linked token, Luna, resulted in over $40 billion in losses and contributed to a broader crypto market collapse.
- The SEC is seeking financial penalties and industry bans against Kwon and Terraform Labs.
- Kwon, who was arrested in March 2023, did not attend the trial, and both the US and South Korea are seeking his extradition on criminal charges.
- Terraform Labs and Kwon's attorneys argued that the company had been truthful about its products, even when they failed, and that the SEC's case relied on statements taken out of context.

title: Do Kwon And Terraform Labs Found Liable For Fraud In SEC Trial
summary:
- Terraform Labs and co-founder Do Kwon have been found liable for fraud in their SEC trial.
- The SEC accused them of misleading investors about the stability of their algorithmic stablecoin, Terra USD.
- The SEC argued that Kwon and Terraform Labs deceived investors about the nature of the algorithm and falsely claimed their blockchain was used in a popular Korean mobile payment app.
- SEC attorney Laura Meehan stated that Terraform's success story was "built on lies" and accused them of having a "secret" working agreement with Jump, a trading shop, to inflate the asset's price.
- Do Kwon was not present at the trial, and the SEC is seeking civil financial penalties and orders barring him and Terraform Labs from the securities industry.

title: New York Jury Finds Do Kwon, Terraform Labs Liable for Fraud in SEC Case

title: TODAY Snags $5M for AI Social Sim Game
summary: AI-driven social simulation game, TODAY, has secured a $5 million seed investment to revolutionize virtual communities with advanced NPC interactions and player-driven creation. Developed by an experienced team, including Oscar-winning crew members, TODAY aims to redefine player engagement through its cutting-edge AI and storytelling. The game allows players to build and manage their own virtual islands, populated by AI-driven Non-Playable Characters (NPCs) with complex personalities and needs. The proprietary character engine, powered by advanced AI, brings the NPCs to life, while extensive no-code creation tools enable players to design and customize their islands for a personalized gaming experience. The seed round funding will accelerate the development of TODAY's vision to create the most immersive and unique social simulation game. The game is preparing for an alpha launch next year and will conduct periodic play tests announced via its Discord channel.

title: Terraform Labs and Do Kwon found liable for fraud in SEC case
summary:

title: Goldfinch’s third default shows just how risky undercollateralised crypto lending can be
summary:

- Critics argue that the defaults highlight the challenges of underwriting emerging-market loans and expose flaws in Goldfinch's model.

- Goldfinch relies on a decentralized group of auditors for credit assessments, but users claim the auditors did a poor job.
- Goldfinch has facilitated 13 fully repaid loans and has eight loans listed as "on time," but its total losses from defaults amount to nearly $18 million.

title: Gasless Voting is Live for ENS
summary: Gasless voting is now available for ENS tokenholders on Tally's ENS DAO. This means that users can vote for free using Tally's Relayer service. Each wallet is allowed up to 8 votes, which includes budgeting for 8 proposals over the next 12 months. Tally aims to address the issue of expensive voting on Ethereum L1 by providing a relayer service that allows DAOs to fund gasless voting transactions. For more information on how the relayer service works, users can refer to Tally's documentation.

title: What the Ethereum Community's Staking Argument Is Really About
summary:
- The Ethereum community is engaged in a debate about staking, which involves locking up ETH as collateral to secure the network.
- Some argue that staking will centralize power and wealth, while others believe it will increase network security and participation.
- Critics of staking worry that it will create a "rich get richer" scenario and reduce decentralization.
- Proponents of staking argue that it will incentivize more people to participate in securing the network and increase its overall security.
- The debate highlights the challenges and trade-offs involved in transitioning to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism.
- Ultimately, the decision on whether to implement staking in Ethereum will have significant implications for the future of the network.

title: Coinbase stands strong in consumer lawsuit as case is revived post-appeal
summary:
- Coinbase's consumer lawsuit, previously dismissed in 2023, has been revived post-appeal.
- Coinbase's chief legal officer, Paul Grewal, stated that companies like Coinbase have no private liability for the secondary trading of crypto tokens due to contracts.
- The US Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit supported the dismissal of the case but revived it due to a date-related error made by the district court.
- The error involved the court referring to the wrong version of Coinbase's user agreement.
- Coinbase argues that the December 2021 agreement is integral to the case, while plaintiffs argue that no version of the agreement is relevant to their claims.
- The lawsuit initially claimed that Coinbase's sale or solicitation of 79 digital assets constituted illegal contracts.

title: [Gauntlet] Introduction of Metrics Tracking Lending Efficiency for Compound V3 Comets (2024/04/05)
summary: Gauntlet has conducted an analysis of non-borrowing depositors in Compound V3 comets and found that their presence reduces the capital efficiency of the protocol. To better assess lending market efficiency, Gauntlet will introduce two metrics: the Non-borrowing Depositor Ratio, which measures the proportion of depositors who have not borrowed against their deposits, and the Non-borrowing Depositors' Fund Ratio, which calculates the share of collateral provided by non-borrowing depositors in relation to the total collateral pool. Gauntlet found that approximately 30% of depositors do not engage in borrowing, with the highest ratio on Base WETH and the lowest on Arbitrum USDC comet. While the majority of non-borrowing depositors are small retail users, deposits can reach up to $8 million. However, their contributions constitute only about 1% of the total collateral in the Compound V3 market. Gauntlet will include these metrics in their weekly updates and provide further recommendations as needed.

title: Ethereum Layer-2 Protocol Starknet Sheds Light On What Caused 4-Hour Block Outage
summary:
- Ethereum layer-2 scaling solution Starknet experienced a four-hour block outage on April 4 due to a rounding error bug.
- The bug caused a reorg of blocks and the transaction backlog reached full capacity, resulting in new transactions being rejected and some transactions being reverted.
- The backlog was eventually cleared and normal network operation resumed.
- The outage caused the price of Starknet to drop initially, but it has since recovered.
- This is not the first challenge for Starknet, as it previously experienced delays and had a change in leadership.
- Despite these challenges, Starknet is set to unlock its cryptocurrency $STRK in April and has a market cap of nearly $1.38 billion.

title: PoolTogether V5 Optimism Launch Plan
summary: PoolTogether V5 is set to launch on Optimism on April 17th after extensive testing and improvements. The protocol has been simplified, hardened, and optimized. Two significant changes have been made since the previous proposal: handling of external incentives and POOL utility. Burst of OP incentives on USDC on Optimism led to the decision to liquidate additional incentives for ETH and contribute them to the prize pool on behalf of the vault. This will increase the chances of winning and the size of prizes for Aave prize vaults. In terms of POOL utility, instead of burning POOL tokens, the reserve will be contributed to prizes on behalf of a POOL prize vault, allowing users to stake their POOL tokens for a chance to win ETH. The deployment on April 17th will include the core protocol, Aave vaults, and peripheral contracts. The Cabana suite of apps and the PoolTogether Developer Site will also be updated. The G9 team will coordinate with Pooltime and others to ensure a smooth transition.

title: ECC Update for April 5 : There is only now

The author expresses their admiration for the TV series Shōgun and quotes a line that resonated with them about the hidden true self. The article then discusses the progress of Zashi, a platform for delivering the capabilities of Zcash. There have been 882 downloads worldwide, with over 1,200 Android downloads of the beta version. Bugs have been reported by iOS users, but the team is working on fixing them. The article also mentions the upcoming release of zcashd 5.9.0 and the author's proposal on changing the development fund. title: ZachXBT claims he is being ‘borderline harassed’ by US law enforcement

- The IRS-CI special agent praised ZachXBT's work and requested his assistance in blockchain investigations.
- ZachXBT believes the multiple means of contact were unprofessional.

title: New Synthetix Perps Markets on Base: SNX, SOL, WIF, and W
summary: Synthetix has launched four new perpetual futures markets on Synthetix Perps, exclusively on Base. The markets include Synthetix (SNX), Solana (SOL), Dogwifhat (WIF), and Wormhole (W). These markets were approved in SIP-363 and SIP-368, with configurable values set by SCCP-316. Traders can access these markets through platforms integrating with Synthetix Perps on Base. Liquidity providers can earn a share of the protocol fees by providing liquidity to these markets. Synthetix also offers liquidity incentives in the form of SNX/USDC rewards for LPs on top of the regular perps trading fees. Increased liquidity in these markets will support higher open interest, increased trading volumes, and the potential for additional markets to be launched on Synthetix Perps. However, providing liquidity is not risk-free, and LPs may experience losses if market skew is imbalanced.

title: Tornado Cash developer gets help in court from blockchain advocacy groups

- The DeFi Education Fund argues that developers should not be held responsible for third-party criminal activity using their software.
- Storm and his lawyers have filed a motion to dismiss the charges, with support from the advocacy groups.
- The case is still in its early proceedings, and it is unclear whether the motion for dismissal will succeed.

title: U.S. CFPB flags risks in virtual worlds’ crypto economy
summary:

- The agency notes that some virtual gaming world publishers are exploring the idea of positioning virtual items as crypto-assets that can be traded outside of the game's economy.
- The CFPB received complaints about hacking attempts, account theft, and asset loss within games, with consumers expressing dissatisfaction over the lack of support from gaming companies.
- The CFPB aims to safeguard consumers from fraud and scams as banking and payments shift to virtual realms.
- The agency has introduced a proposed rule to grant oversight over larger nonbank firms providing digital wallet and payment app services, which critics argue asserts authority over cryptocurrency inappropriately.

title: Terraform Labs and Co-Founder Do Kwon Found Guilty of Fraud in SEC Case

title: Pattern Matching ICRC-7/37
summary: The article discusses the challenges faced by Motoko developers when writing tests due to complicated array pattern matching. The previous pattern matching approach involved using a switch statement with multiple cases, which became cumbersome when dealing with arrays. The new approach involves using batch by default and returning values in the format #ok([?#Ok(Nat)]). The article suggests a clever way to pattern match inside an array, proposing a trap for testing purposes. However, it is mentioned that pattern matching in arrays is only possible for a fixed length. The article concludes by mentioning a solution provided by rossberg in post #2, which involves pattern matching arrays with a fixed length.

- Crypto gaming has gained increased interest and activity, with gaming tokens reaching a market capitalization of over $26.9 billion in Q1 2024.

title: Distribute 200k OP from DAO vault on Optimism to tricrypto pools over 8 weeks
summary: Curve, a decentralized exchange protocol, plans to distribute 200,000 OP tokens from its DAO vault on the Optimism network to tricrypto pools over the course of eight weeks. The goal is to bootstrap Curve Lending on Optimism. To achieve this, Curve will use the Optimism broadcaster to send a cross-chain message to the relayer on Optimism. The message will transfer the specified amount of OP tokens to the streamer contract, which has been initialized with a reward duration of eight weeks. The crvUSD/WBTC/WETH and crvUSD/OP/CRV gauges will be added as receivers, and the OP token will be added as a reward token in the two gauges. Anyone can call the reward streamer to distribute the OP tokens to the gauges. This move is part of Curve's efforts to expand its lending services to different networks.

title: Badger DAO Q1 24 Review
summary: The article discusses the concept of vote delegation in the context of Badger DAO. Vote delegation allows holders of the BADGER token to delegate their voting power to chosen delegates through snapshot's UI. Delegates can then use the delegated voting power to vote on snapshot, but it does not grant them any other rights. Delegation is a permissionless system, allowing anyone to delegate voting power to others and end the delegation at any time. The article highlights the benefits of delegation, including increased governance engagement and efficiency, transparency, and direction. Delegation allows token holders to participate in governance even if they don't have enough tokens or don't want to invest the time to understand each proposal. It also enables those with unused voting power to delegate it to knowledgeable individuals who can actively participate in the governance process. The article concludes by inviting individuals or organizations interested in being delegates to set up their Snapshot profile.

title: Is This Bitcoin Halving Strategy Indeed the Most Profitable?

- The analyst's strategy suggests that Bitcoin's price bottoms out around 500 days before each halving and peaks around 500 days after.
- The last halving occurred in May 2020, and Bitcoin reached an all-time high of $69,000 around 19 months later.
- The upcoming halving is expected to be completed in approximately 16-17 months, and some predictions suggest Bitcoin could reach $150,000 or even $200,000 in the year following the halving. However, this strategy is speculative and investors should conduct their own research.

title: Upcoming Astar zkEVM Upgrade & Maintenance
summary: The Astar zkEVM upgrade is scheduled to take place on the zKyoto testnet and Astar zkEVM mainnet. The network will be upgraded from Fork ID 7 to Fork ID 9, which is the Polygon CDK version Elderberry v2. The native bridge will be unavailable for approximately 2 hours before and during the maintenance. The zKyoto testnet update is set for April 8, 2024, at 12 PM UTC, while the Astar zkEVM mainnet update will occur on April 10, 2024, at 12 PM UTC. Node version 0.6.4-cdk.2 is recommended for projects to update after the Astar zkEVM upgrade is completed. The update involves stopping the RPC, Synchronizer, and Executor components, updating the node to 0.6.4-cdk.2, and updating the Prover/Executor to v6.0.0 (Elderberry 2). After the upgrade, dApp developers and end users will not need to take any action, but infrastructure developers will need to follow the necessary steps.

title: Crypto Advocacy Groups Support Tornado Cash Developer in Legal Battle – Here’s the Latest
summary:
- Tornado Cash developer, Storm, has filed a motion to drop charges against him related to his role in the Ethereum privacy protocol.
- Coin Center, the Blockchain Association, and the DeFi Education Fund have filed amicus briefs in support of Storm, making similar arguments against the government's indictment.
- The government alleges that Storm operated as an unregistered money transmitter, but the Blockchain Association argues that Tornado Cash does not meet the criteria for this classification.
- Coin Center's brief focuses on the count of conspiracy to violate the International Economic Emergency Powers Act (IEEPA) and provides a First Amendment defense.
- The DeFi Education Fund's brief challenges the charges and warns of the potential consequences if Storm were to lose the case.
- Government prosecutors have not yet responded to Storm's motion to dismiss the charges.

title: Coin98 Integrates Kava EVM, Enhancing Web3 Interoperability and Scalability
summary: Coin98, a crypto super app, has integrated Kava EVM, an EVM-compatible layer within the Kava blockchain. This integration allows Solidity developers to bring their Ethereum-based applications into the Kava network, benefiting from enhanced performance, security, and the advantages of the Cosmos ecosystem. Coin98 Super Wallet users can now easily create or restore Kava wallets and transfer KAVA tokens seamlessly. They also gain access to a wide range of decentralized applications (dApps) within the Kava EVM ecosystem, opening up opportunities within the DeFi landscape. Coin98 recommends creating a multi-chain wallet on their platform to manage and access all blockchain wallets with one passphrase. Coin98 aims to connect a billion users to the crypto world safely and securely, offering a comprehensive ecosystem of essential services.

title: DWF Labs Liquidity Enhancement Proposal
summary: DWF Labs, a Web3 investor and market maker, has proposed a liquidity enhancement plan for API3, a blockchain oracle project. DWF Labs aims to increase the liquidity of API3's native token by utilizing its market-making expertise across multiple exchanges. The proposal includes a loan of 1,000,000 API3 tokens for a period of 24 months, with DWF Labs providing a 6% annualized interest payable every 4 weeks in USDC tokens. Additionally, European call options are offered, with 33% of the loaned tokens having strike prices of $5, $6, and $7.5 respectively. The proposal requires a vote from the API3 DAO, with a "FOR" vote enabling the implementation of the support and loan + call options, and an "AGAINST" vote preventing the proposal from proceeding. DWF Labs aims to minimize costs and enhance liquidity for API3, supporting the growth and development of the ecosystem.

title: Elon Musk's Grok AI Chatbot Has Weakest Security, While Meta's Llama Stands Strong: Researchers
summary:
- Security researchers tested the security of popular AI chatbots and found that Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot had the weakest security measures.
- The researchers used linguistic manipulation and programming logic exploitation techniques to test the chatbots' vulnerabilities.
- Grok was found to be more susceptible to jailbreaking attempts and provided responses that were considered harmful or unethical.
- Meta's LLAMA chatbot was ranked as the safest model, followed by Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4.
- The researchers aim to collaborate with chatbot developers to improve AI safety protocols.
- Hackers can exploit jailbroken models for malicious purposes, such as creating phishing emails and generating hate speech at scale.

title: ETH Mainnet Legacy Spot Synth Migration
summary: Synthetix, a decentralized synthetic asset platform, is deprecating the exchange of non-USD spot synths on Ethereum Mainnet (L1) and migrating users to the V3 system. This move aims to manage the V2X skew and increase liquidity on V3. Spot synth exchanges on V2X Optimism will not be affected. Users holding sETH, sBTC, or other non-USD spot synths must swap them by April 15th. After this date, any remaining non-USD spot synths can only be redeemed via the L1 redeemer contract at the Chainlink price for sUSD. The Spartan Council plans to lower the discount factor, potentially resulting in users receiving fewer sUSD. Migrating liquidity to sUSD will help balance the skew and reduce exposure to ETH/BTC. The deprecation of spot synths is crucial for the launch of new products in Synthetix V3. Users holding sUSD will not be diluted, and those on Optimism are not affected.

title: SurveyEase: A Secure and Customizable Survey Tool Built on the Internet Computer
summary: SurveyEase is a survey tool built on the Internet Computer (IC) that allows users to create, distribute, and analyze questionnaires. It offers flexibility in designing surveys with various question types and customization options. The tool supports multiple languages and provides advanced analytics for data insights. SurveyEase utilizes the power of the IC to enhance security and scalability. It leverages Flutter for the frontend and Motoko for the backend. The wizard flow engine is the core component of SurveyEase, generating dynamic surveys based on a JSON payload and facilitating offline data collection. The tool operates on a freemium model, with paid tiers offering increased capacity. SurveyEase is currently in the development stage and plans to launch an alpha release, a web version, and secure partnerships with professors and researchers for wider adoption.

title: How Much are Golden Pearls Worth?
summary:
- Golden pearls, also known as golden South Sea pearls, are highly sought-after treasures of the sea.
- They come from the gold-lip Pinctada maxima oyster found in warm waters of the South Seas.
- The value of golden pearls is determined by factors such as size, shape, color, luster, surface quality, and thickness of nacre.
- Larger pearls with round shapes and thick nacre command higher prices.
- Quality is paramount, with flawless surfaces, high luster, and well-defined shapes being highly valued.
- Most golden pearls in the market are synthetic, but high-quality cultured pearls can still fetch significant prices.

- Notcoin token, a viral Telegram-based game, will launch its NOT token on The Open Network (TON) around April 20, the estimated date of the Bitcoin halving.
- Saga's SAGA token, from the layer-1 blockchain network Saga, will launch on April 9, and Binance is holding a Launchpool campaign with over $13.3 billion worth of tokens staked by more than 450,000 users.
- The BitBoy One is a Bitcoin-centric handheld gaming device that can run play-to-earn games, emulate classic games, work as a Bitcoin hardware wallet, and mine crypto airdrops.
- Coachella music festival is launching an on-site game that allows attendees to collect Avalanche NFT-based stamps via an app and earn prizes, rewards, and special access.
- Solana-based hero shooter Nyan Heroes has had over 100,000 players in its pre-alpha demo and offers NFT rewards and MEOW points for the NYAN token airdrop.
- Various other updates and original stories in the crypto gaming space.

title: Shiba Inu: Don't rule out THIS possibility from SHIB's price because...

title: How Much is Danica Patrick Worth?
summary:
- Danica Patrick, a racing sensation, has made a name for herself as a trailblazer and icon in the world of motorsports.
- She started her racing career at a young age and achieved notable accomplishments, including being the first woman to lead laps and secure a top-five finish at the Indianapolis 500.
- Patrick's success on the track earned her a spot on the Forbes list of the 100 highest-paid celebrities.
- In addition to racing, she has ventured into entrepreneurship and endorsement deals with brands like Chevrolet, Coca-Cola, and Nationwide Insurance.
- Estimates place Danica Patrick's net worth at around $80 million.
- Her impact on motorsports and her entrepreneurial ventures make her a true trailblazer and an inspiration to many.
